intro: Calonyction bona-nox, commonly known as the night-flowering catchfly, is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-purple flowers that open in the evening and close by dawn. Its leaves are opposite and covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. The species is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils.
